==Dateline==
==Dateline==
  +
{{update section}}
On February 20, thousands of Moroccans rallied in the capital, [[Rabat]], to demand that King Mohammed give up some of his powers, chanting slogans like: "Down with autocracy" and "The people want to change the constitution".<ref>
On February 20, thousands of Moroccans rallied in the capital, [[Rabat]], to demand that King Mohammed give up some of his powers, chanting slogans like: "Down with autocracy" and "The people want to change the constitution".<ref>
{{cite news| url=http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424052748703498804576156180408970252.html?mod=googlenews_wsj | work=The Wall Street Journal | first=Marc | last=Champion | title=Morocco Joins in, Defying Predictions}}</ref> They were heading towards parliament and police had not tried to halt them, although Moroccan Finance Minister Salaheddine Mezouar said people should not join the march. A separate protest was also under way in [[Casablanca]] and one was planned for [[Marrakesh]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-12518116 |title=Morocco protesters demand political change |publisher=BBC |date=2011-02-20 |accessdate=2011-02-20}}</ref> Acts of looting and major disorder were widespread in Tangier,<ref>{{cite
